document.docAuthor: Chani-Posse, Mariana, Newton, Alfred F., Hansen, Aslak Kappel & Solodovnikov, Alexey
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist and taxonomic changes for Central and South American Philonthina (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist and taxonomic changes for Central and South American Philonthina (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae)

bibRefCitation.refString: Ganglbauer, L. (1895) Die Kafer von Mitteleuropa. Die Kafer der osterreichisch-ungarischen Monarchie, Deutschlands, der Schweiz, sowie des franzosischen und italienischen Alpengebietes. 2. Familienreihe Staphylinoidea. Theil I. Staphylinidae, Pselaphidae. Carl Gerold's Sohn, Wien, 881 pp.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neobisnius
Ganglbauer 1895 : 464
. Type species:
Gabrius villosulus Stephens, 1833
, designated by
Lucas (1920: 434)
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes:
Neobisnius
is a worldwide distributed genus including 72 species at present. Among them, 35 species have been reported from the Neotropical region. The New World species of the genus were revised by Frank (1981) .

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neobisnius aeneipennis
Bruch 1915 : 500
, attributed to Bernhauer in litteris ; nomen nudum. Locality: Catamarca . Distribution: Argentina . Note: not in
Fernández et al. (2007)
or
Bachmann et al. (2017)
.

bibRefCitation.refString: Bierig, A. (1933) Especies nuevas o poco conocidas de Neobisniu s (Col. Staphylinidae) de la region neotropica. Revista de Entomologia, 3, 48 - 57.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neobisnius armuellensis
Bierig 1933 : 56
. Type locality: Puerto Armuelles,
Panamá
. Type depository: FMNH 4 ST. Distribution:
Costa Rica
,
Panama
, Colombia . Note: redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 28
).

bibRefCitation.refString: Wendeler, H. (1956) Neue Staphyliniden aus Brasilien (2. Teil; 3. Teil; 4. u. 5. Teil; 6. u. 7. Teil (Schluss )). Dusenia, 7, 37 - 44 + 129 - 138 + 219 - 234 + 261 - 276.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neobisnius brasilianus
Wendeler 1956 : 230
. Type locality: Brasilien , Nova Teutonia
.
Type depository: ZMHB ( Wendeler ) HT ♀ [ MCP seen]. Distribution : Brazil ( Santa Catarina )
. Note: redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 25
); distribution within Brazil (Asenjo et al. 2013).

Actobius concolor
Sharp 1885 : 458
. Type locality: Panama, Volcan de Chiriqui 4000–6000 ft , Peña Blanca 3000– 4000 ft . Type depository: BMNH 13 ST: 10 Chiriqui, 1 Peña Blanca [MCP seen]; FMNH 2 ST: 2 Chiriqui. Distribution: Panama;?Mexico. Note: comb. nov. ex
Actobius (
Bernhauer & Schubert 1914: 322
)
; status dubious , may be synonym of
N. sobrinus Erichson
, redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 27
).

bibRefCitation.refString: Bierig, A. (1933) Especies nuevas o poco conocidas de Neobisniu s (Col. Staphylinidae) de la region neotropica. Revista de Entomologia, 3, 48 - 57.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neobisnius demmeli
Bierig 1933 : 54
. Type locality: cercanía de Cayajabos, Sierra del Rosario, Prov. P. del Rio, Cuba. Type depository: FMNH 2 ST [orig. 5]; USNM 1 ST. Distribution: Cuba. Note: revised status, ex synonym of
N. humilis Erichson
, redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 32
); distribution within Cuba ( Peck 2005 ).

bibRefCitation.refString: Frank, J. H. (1981) A revision of the New World species of the genus Neobisnius Ganglbauer (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae: Staphylininae). Occasional Papers of the Florida State Collection of Arthropods, 1, i - vii + 1 - 60.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neobisnius edznai
Frank 1981 : 44
. Type locality: Edzná, Campeche ,
Mexico
, 150 ft . Type depository: BMNH HT ♂ , etc. Distribution:
Mexico
,
Guatemala
. Note: distribution, also within
Mexico
(
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
).

Actobius facilis
Sharp 1885 : 458
. Type locality: San Jerónimo, Baja Verapaz ,
Guatemala
. Type depository: BMNH HT ♂ : from San “Gerónimo” [ MCP seen]. Distribution:
Mexico
,
Guatemala
, El Salvador , Nicaragua . Notes: comb. nov. ex
Actobius (
Bernhauer & Schubert 1914: 323
)
; redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 37
); distribution, also within
Mexico
(
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
).

bibRefCitation.refString: Bierig, A. (1933) Especies nuevas o poco conocidas de Neobisniu s (Col. Staphylinidae) de la region neotropica. Revista de Entomologia, 3, 48 - 57.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neobisnius flavipes
Bierig 1933 : 50
. Type locality: Puerto Armuelles , Panamá
.
Type depository: FMNH ? HT, #?PT [not seen]. Distribution : Panama . Note: redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 23
).

bibRefCitation.refString: Bernhauer, M. (1908) Beitrag zur Staphylinidenfauna von Sudamerika. Archiv fur Naturgeschichte, 74 (1), 283 - 372.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neobisnius flavomaculatus
Bernhauer 1908 : 336
. Type locality: Santa Catarina , Brazil & Grenada , W. I. Type depository: FMNH 3 ST. Distribution: Colombia , Bolivia , Brazil ,
Paraguay
, Uruguay , Grenada ;? Argentina . Notes: Argentina distribution (
Bruch 1928: 444
); redescription, distribution Grenada (
Frank 1981: 15
); distribution within Brazil (Asenjo et al. 2013).

=
Neobisnius flavomaculatus
Bruch 1915 : 501
, attributed to Bernhauer in litteris (see
flavomaculatus
Bernhauer 1908 : 336
). Locality: San Luis . Distribution: Argentina . Notes: there are two specimens deposited at MACN under this name, one from San Luis and the other one from Buenos Aires ( Argentina ). The specimen from San Luis is, without any doubt, the one referred by Bruch (1915) . It does not agree with the original description of the species (
Bernhauer 1908: 336
) and it is
N. parcepunctatus Bernhauer. The
specimen from Buenos Aires is
N. flavomaculatus
indeed.

Actobius fortis
Sharp 1885 : 457
. Type locality:
Panama
, Volcan de Chiriqui 4000–6000 ft , Bugaba 800–1500 ft . Type depository: BMNH 2 ST: 1 Chiriqui , 1 Bugaba [ MCP seen]. Distribution:
Panama
, Colombia , Brazil , Argentina . Note: comb. nov. ex
Actobius (
Bernhauer & Schubert 1914: 323
)
; redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 36
); distribution within (and including) Brazil (Asenjo et al. 2013)

Neobisnius fraternus
Bernhauer 1921c : 105
. Type locality: Jujuy prov., Argentina
.
Type depository: FMNH 1 ST. Distribution : Argentina . Notes: redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 29
).

bibRefCitation.refString: Cameron, M. (1922) Descriptions of new species of Staphylinidae from the West Indies. Part II (continued). Annals and Magazine of Natural History, Series 9, 9, 113 - 128, 633 - 652. https: // doi. org / 10.1080 / 00222932208632721

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neobisnius funerulus
Cameron 1922 : 119
, attributed to Fauvel in litteris . Type locality: St. Vincent . Type depository: BMNH HT. Distribution: Lesser Antilles ( St. Vincent , St. Lucia ). Notes: redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 34
); distribution within Lesser Antilles ( St. Vincent ) ( Peck 2010 ).

Philonthus gratus
LeConte 1863 : 38
. Type locality: Colorado River, near Fort Yuma, California [North America]. Type depository: MCZ LT + 4 PLT . Distribution: USA ,
Mexico
;? Argentina . Notes: as
Actobius (
Horn, 1884: 231
)
; comb. nov. ex
Actobius (
Bernhauer 1912b: 176
)
; lectotype designation, redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 16
); Argentina (
Bruch 1928: 444
).

Philonthus humilis
Erichson 1840 : 512
. Type locality: ins. Puerto Rico . Type depository: ZMHB LT ♂ , 3 PLT . Distribution: Cuba , Jamaica , Hispaniola, Puerto Rico , Cayman Is., Virgin Is.;? Grenada . Notes: comb. nov. ex
Philonthus (
Bernhauer & Schubert 1914: 323
)
; lectotype designation (
Smetana 1963: 4
); redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 18, not including Grenada
); distribution, also within Cuba ( Peck 2005 ); distribution within (and including) Cayman Is. (Frank et al. 2011); Grenada and other Lesser Antilles ( Blackwelder 1944 , but not confirmed by Frank (1981) , probably refers to former synonym.

=
Neobisnius limbatus
Cameron 1922 : 118
. Type locality: Haiti. Type depository: BMNH (Cameron) 4 ST (as “paratypes”, see
Frank 1981 : 18
). Distribution: Haiti. Note: as synonym of
N. humilis ( Blackwelder 1943 )
.

Actobius jocosus
Horn 1884 : 232
. Type locality: Delaware ;
North Carolina
[no specific locality]. Type depository: MCZ LT ♀ . Distribution: USA (e),
Mexico
,
Guatemala
, Honduras , El Salvador . Notes: comb. nov. ex
Actobius (
Bernhauer & Schubert 1914: 323
)
; lectotype designation, redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 27
); distribution, also within
Mexico
(
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
).

=
Actobius alternans
Sharp 1885 : 461
. Type locality: Guatemala, San Gerónimo, Torola, Paso Antonio; Paso Antonio, 400 ft ., Escuintla, Guatemala (LT). Type depository: BMNH LT, 3 PLT, additional 4 PLT?: 2 San Gerónimo, 2 Torola [MCP seen]. Notes: comb. nov. ex
Actobius (
Bernhauer & Schubert 1914: 322
)
; lectotype designation, as synonym of
N. jocosus (
Frank 1981: 27
)
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Neobisnius lathrobioides (Baudi di Selve, 1848 )
[adventive in CASA ]

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Philonthus lathrobioides Baudi di
Selve 1848 : 130
. Type locality: Pedemontio. Type depository: MRSN / MCSN ? #? ST. Distribution: Europe, Egypt , Tunisia , Algeria , Morocco , Turkey ,
Azerbaijan
, Iran ; adventive in Azores, Canary Is., Madeira, Canada , USA , Chile , Australia , Madagascar . Notes: lectotype designation; valid species (
Bordoni 1975: 82
); redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 9
).

Philonthus ludicrus
Erichson 1840 : 514
. Type locality: Guyana Venezuelensi. Type depository: ZMHB LT ♂ , 1 PLT . Distribution: USA ,
Mexico
,
Guatemala
, Honduras ,
Costa Rica
,
Panama
, Colombia , Venezuela , Bolivia , Brazil , Trinidad , Virgin Is., Barbados , Grenada , St. Vincent , St. Lucia . Notes: comb. nov. ex
Philonthus (
Bernhauer & Schubert 1914: 323
)
; lectotype designation, redescription and distribution (
Frank 1981: 20
); distribution, also within
Mexico
(
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
), Barbados ( Peck 2009a ), Lesser Antilles ( St. Vincent ) ( Peck 2010 ); Brazil (Asenjo et al. 2013).

=
Philonthus umbripennis
LeConte 1863 : 38
. Type locality: Middle states [ USA ]
.
Type depository: MCZ HT ♀ . Note : new synonym of
N. ludicrus (
Frank 1981: 20
)
.

=
Philonthus deletus
Sharp 1876a : 167
. Type locality: Tapajos [ Pará , Brazil ]. Type depository: BMNH 4 ST: from Tapajos [ MCP seen]. Distribution: Brazil . Note: comb. nov. ex
Philonthus
, as synonym of
N. ludicrus (
Frank 1981: 20
)
.

=
Neobisnius fauveli
Smetana 1963 : 2
(proposed for
N. agnatus
of
Horn 1884 : 229
(misidentification)). Type locality: Louisiana , USA . Type depository: IRSNB HT ♂ , 1PT. Note: treated as a subspecies of
N. ludicrus
by Frank (1981) , for dark specimens from Texas to northwest Florida , but treated as an implicit or explicit synonym of
N. ludicrus
by subsequent authors (e.g., Frank 1986,
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
, respectively).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Othius semi-punctatus
Fairmaire & Germain 1862 : 434. Type locality: Santiago [Chile]. Type depository: MNHN? #?ST. Distribution: Chile. Notes: status, types, Chile only, other localities misidentified ( Fagel 1954 ); redescription ( Frank 1981: 10 ); distribution ( Coiffait & Sáiz 1968 , Frank 1981 ).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neobisnius semirufus
Bernhauer 1921c : 105
. Type locality: Salta prov., Argentina . Type depository: FMNH HT. Distribution: Argentina , Bolivia . Note: redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 33
).

Actobius senilis
Horn 1884 : 226
. Type locality: Garland, Costilla Co., Colorado , USA . Type depository: MCZ LT ♂ , 2 PLT . Distribution: Canada ,
Mexico
. Notes: comb. nov. ex
Actobius (
Bernhauer & Schubert 1914: 323
)
; lectotype designation, redescription (
Frank 1981: 45
); distribution ( Frank 1981 ,
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
); distribution, also within
Mexico
(
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
).

=
Philonthus piger
Horn 1884 : 219
(in key). Note: This name appeared in a key to some species of
Philonthus
, with characters but without other data, but in "Additions and notes" at the end of the same publication
Horn (1884: 240)
indicated this name was a synonym of
Actobius senilis
described in the same work (see above).

Actobius simplex

. Type locality: Mirador, Veracruz ,
Mexico
. Type depository: BMNH HT ♂ . Distribution:
Mexico
,
Guatemala
, El Salvador ,
Costa Rica
,
Panama
, Brazil . Note: comb. nov. ex
Actobius (
Bernhauer & Schubert 1914: 323
)
; redescription, distribution (
Frank 1981: 42
); distribution, also within
Mexico
(
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
); distribution within Brazil (Asenjo et al. 2013).

=
Neobisnius cavifrons
Bierig 1933 : 51
. Type locality: Puerto Armuelles , Chiriquí , Panama
.
Type depository: FMNH HT, #?PT; SDEI 1 +PT. Distribution : Panama . Note: as synonym of
N. simplex ( Frank 1981 )
.

Philonthus sobrinus
Erichson 1840 : 512
. Type locality: Pensylvania . Type depository: ZMHB LT, 3 PLT . Distribution: Canada , USA ,
Mexico
,
Guatemala
,
Costa Rica
, Colombia , Venezuela , Brazil . Notes: comb. nov. ex
Philonthus (
Bernhauer & Schubert 1914: 323
)
; lectotype designation (
Smetana 1963: 4
); redescription and distribution (
Frank 1981: 39
); distribution, also within
Mexico
(
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
); distribution within Brazil (Asenjo et al. 2013).

=

Erichson 1840 : 513
. Type locality: valle Araguensi Columbiae [Rio Araguas in Santander ]. Type depository: ZMHB LT ♂ , 3 PLT . Distribution: Colombia . Notes: comb. nov. ex
Philonthus (
Bernhauer & Schubert 1914: 322
)
; lectotype designation (
Smetana 1963: 4
); as synonym of
N. sobrinus ( Frank 1981 )
.

=

Horn 1884 : 228
. Type locality: California . Type depository: MCZ LT ♂
.

N. sobrinus ( Frank 1981 )
.

=

. Type locality: Puebla, Mexico. Type depository: BMNH LT ♂, 14+ PLT. Distribution: Mexico. Notes: comb. nov. ex
Actobius (

)

=

. Type locality: Curling, W Newfoundland , Canada
.

: type deposition correction, as synonym of
N. sobrinus ( Frank 1981 )
.

Neobisnius terminalis ( LeConte 1863 )
Philonthus terminalis
LeConte 1863 : 38
. Type locality: Maryland [North America]. Type depository: MCZ LT + 1

subSubSection.paragraph:
PLT ? (see Frank 1981 : 13). Distribution: Canada , USA ,
Mexico
,
Guatemala
,
Costa Rica
,
Panama
. Notes: as
Neobisnius ( Bierig 1933: 56 )
; lectotype designation, redescription ( Frank 1981: 13 ); distribution ( Frank 1981 , Brunke & Marshall 2011 ,
Navarrete-Heredia et al. 2002
).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:

(e.g.,

).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Neobisnius vigii
Frank 1981 : 43
. Type depository: CNC HT ♂ , ZMHB 1 PT. Type locality: Colombia : Madgalena , Parque Tayrona ,
21 mi E of Santa Marta
.
Distribution : Colombia . Note: PT from " La Vigi ", not located.
